page.title: 05FRECKLETON BY-PASS
page.content: The village of Freckleton has been involved in a battle for a multi-million pound by-pass. The residents feel they have been snubbed in the campaign to have a route placed around the village. The village, which straddles the busy A584, had its dream three million pound scheme dropped in 1982 by the Labour County Council. Councillor Rigby, one of the Freckleton residents said, "The row has been going on for nearly 30 years and still no solution has been found. Not only has Freckleton to cope with the inconvenience caused by aircraft noise, but also 6000 cars crawl through its centre for 2 hours every morning and evening". These are the employees of the Warton Division of British Aerospace. Heavy lorries also use the road.
